case_vignette:
An 18-year-old girl comes to the emergency room with abdominal pain. She states that the pain started 6 hours ago, is 8/10, and localizes to the right lower abdomen. She recalls a similar episode last month. Her older brother was hospitalized 2 years ago for perforated appendicitis. Her mother has diverticulitis. The patient got her first menstrual period at age 14. Her periods occur regularly every 28 days. Her last menstrual period was 2 weeks ago. She is sexually active with multiple partners and uses condoms inconsistently. The patient’s temperature is 99°F (37.2°C), blood pressure is 110/74 mmHg, pulse is 89/min, and respirations are 14/min with an oxygen saturation of 98% on room air. On physical exam, the patient is in moderate distress. There is lower abdominal tenderness with guarding. A pelvic examination reveals clear mucous in the vaginal introitus, a mobile uterus, and tenderness of the right adnexa. Labs are obtained, as shown below:

Leukocyte count: 10,000/mm^3 with normal differential
Hemoglobin: 13.5 g/dL
Platelet count: 200,000/mm^3
Beta-human chorionic gonadotropin: Pending

A pelvic ultrasound demonstrates a small fluid collection in the cul-de-sac posterior to the uterus.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. I have abdominal pain that started 6 hours ago, and it's really bad on my right lower side.
Have you had any vaginal bleeding or discharge?
No bleeding, but there's some clear discharge.
Have you had any fever or chills?
I have a temperature of 99°F, so just a slight fever, but no chills.
Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle?
No changes, my periods come every 28 days, and the last one was 2 weeks ago.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
The case vignette does not provide information about changes in my weight or appetite.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress level or lifestyle?
The case vignette does not provide information about changes in my stress level or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to any new environments?
The case vignette does not provide information about recent travel or exposure to new environments.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication regimen?
The case vignette does not provide information about any changes in my medication regimen.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history?
Family history can't change; however, my case mentions that my brother had appendicitis two years ago and my mother has diverticulitis.
Final Diagnosis: Appendicitis.
